page.title: 04Young mother, Mawdesley
page.content: We interviewed a mother who had recently moved into the village, to find out how she liked living here. She has lived here for eight months. She lives in a detached house, with her husband and two children, aged ten and nine, who attend the village school. Although she likes living in Mawdesley, she does not take part in village activities but takes a keen interest in parents' activities at school. The family used to live in a town, and now enjoy the peaceful atmosphere of the village. The biggest disadvantage of living here is the lack of public transport. Most things are available at the local shops, but when "big" shopping is necessary, the family go by car to Southport.
